definition: to sympathize/to pity/to feel compassion for

sentences.english: What remains of IndyMac's franchise is of questionable value , to put it charitably .
sentences.chinese: 怜悯的说，因地美特许权价值还剩几许值得怀疑，。

sentences.english: An understanding heart gives you empathy and compassion for others.
sentences.chinese: 一个有理性的新会给你情感和怜悯之心。

sentences.english: Once famous, he is now a mere object of pity.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经名噪一时，但现在不过是一个让人怜悯的对象。

sentences.english: His tearfulness about her fate had already diminished.
sentences.chinese: 他怜悯她命运的情愫早已经荡然无存了。

sentences.english: Those who return evil for good may expect their neighbor's pity to be worn out at last.
sentences.chinese: 以怨报德的人，最后将失去邻居的怜悯。

sentences.english: Letting go my strength and weakness, Breathing in Thy life divine.
sentences.chinese: 放弃软弱或是力劲，吸入怜悯和恩湛。

sentences.english: He is much happier talking about courage than compassion.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他更喜欢谈“胆量”，不擅长与你侃“怜悯”。

sentences.english: He let them be pitied by all those who held them captive.
sentences.chinese: 使他们在俘掳他们的人前，成为自己慈爱怜悯的因缘。

sentences.english: He even says as much, but please  have mercy.
He looked so dispirited I took pity on him.
sentences.chinese: 他那十分沮丧的样子令我产生了怜悯。

sentences.english: In devotion woman is sublimely superior to man.
sentences.chinese: 怜悯是女子胜过男子的德性之一。

sentences.english: I pity anyone who has to feed a family on such a low income.
sentences.chinese: 我怜悯任何必要以如此菲薄的收益养活百口的人。

sentences.english: Prior to his election, Benedict had a reputation for learning and piety.
sentences.chinese: 据记载在他当选之前他以其怜悯和好学而著称。

sentences.english: She doesn't know the meaning of pity. She has a heart of stone.
sentences.chinese: 看到我这样的死法，即使铁石心肠的人也会怜悯你的。

sentences.english: But the King of Kosala had no mercy.
sentences.chinese: 但是科萨拉国王毫不怜悯。

sentences.english: Remember always, as you go inwards, to have compassion for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 请你一直记住，当你走入你的内心时，要有怜悯心。

definition: to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
